thread.title: Aguero robbed perfect impact after Jesus injury
thread.title_full: Aguero robbed perfect impact after Jesus injury

title: Aguero robbed perfect impact after Jesus injury
text:
Manchester City v Bournemouth: Aguero has goal ruled as own goal  39am   AFP SERGIO Aguero thought he had made the perfect impression on Pep Guardiola after coming on and scoring following Gabriel Jesus’ injury. 
The Argentine was once again confined to Manchester City’s bench for the start of their 2-0 win Bournemouth after the Spanish manager chose to play his new Brazilian starlet over Aguero. 
But when Jesus was forced off with injury in the 14th minute after a clash with Bournemouth defender Simon Francis, Aguero was handed an opportunity. 
Despite volleying over a cross in the first half in an offside position - that the linesman failed to flag - the striker made amends when he scored in the 68th minute. Or at least he thought he had. 
Raheem Sterling, who had scored City’s first goal, beat his defender and played a low cross to Aguero at the near post. Manchester City's Argentinian striker Sergio Aguero (R) comes on as substitute. Source: AFP 
Despite pressure from Cherries defender Tyrone Mings, the 28-year-old got his foot to the ball as saw it bulge in the net. 
Aguero celebrated his goal, but later in the match the Premier League Twitter account confirmed that his strike had been confirmed as an own goal. #PL Match Centre: Man City's 2nd goal has been confirmed as a Tyrone Mings own goal #BOUMCI — Premier League (@premierleague) February 13, 2017 
Replays showed Aguero had made contact with the ball before it came off Mings’ foot and into the net. 
However, the goal would have been Aguero’s as long as his shot was directed on target. 
On close inspection of the camera angles, it’s incredibly difficult to ascertain whether Aguero’s shot was directed on target. 
Former Manchester United midfielder Owen Hargreaves said it’s impossible to decide whether it was on target but that Aguero would have “definitely wanted it.” Aguero gets the first touch. Source: FOX SPORTS It looks like it’s heading for the far corner. Source: FOX SPORTS King’s foot sends the ball into the goal. Source: FOX SPORTS 
Yesterday, Guardiola admitted that he wasn’t sure if Aguero would stay at the club. 
“At the end of the season I don’t know,” said Guardiola. 
“I know how difficult it is to find top goalscorers. 
“I would like him to remain, but I don’t know what is going to happen. Even in my career I didn’t know what would happen at the end of the season.” 
Hargreaves added after City’s win: “Hopefully he can stay at City and those players can form a partnership but it doesn’t look certain.”
